4 Resources Today we’ve just given you a very brief overview of R and R Studio. If you want to take this further, please see the resources below. In the video (see under ‘Before the practical session’), I you through what these all are and how they might be useful. 4.1 Introductions RYouWithMe (Rladies - Sydney) R for Reproducible Scientific Analysis (Software Carpentry) 4.2 More on basics of working with data in R R Studio Primers 4.3 More advanced R for Data Science (Hadley Wickham & Garrett Grolemund) 4.4 Basic stats Teacups, giraffes and statistics (Hasse Walum & Desirée de Leon) PsyTeachR (Glasgow University) 4.5 More comprehensive stats Winter, B. (2020). Statistics for Linguists: An Introduction Using R.
